SEARCH
Package com.example.teamalfred.database

Interface UserDAO

All Known Implementing Classes:
SqliteUserDAO
public interface UserDAO
Defines the contract for User Data Access Object (DAO) operations. Lists what can be done with User data, decoupling the application from the specific database implementation.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    createUser(User user)
    Creates a new user record in the database.
    void
    deleteUser(int id)
    Deletes a user from the database based on their ID.
    Optional<User>
    findUserByEmail(String email)
    Finds a user by their email address.
    Optional<User>
    findUserById(int id)
    Finds a user by their unique ID.

    getAllUsers()
    Retrieves a list of all users from the database.
    void
    updateUser(User user)
    Updates an existing user's details in the database.

  • Method Details

    • createUser

      void createUser(User user) throws SQLException
      Creates a new user record in the database.
      Parameters:
      user - The user object containing data for the new record.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • updateUser

      void updateUser(User user) throws SQLException
      Updates an existing user's details in the database. Assumes the user object contains the ID of the user to update.
      Parameters:
      user - The user object containing updated data.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • deleteUser

      void deleteUser(int id) throws SQLException
      Deletes a user from the database based on their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique ID of the user to delete.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • findUserByEmail

      Optional<User> findUserByEmail(String email) throws SQLException
      Finds a user by their email address.
      Parameters:
      email - The email address to search for.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the found User, or an empty Optional if no user with that email exists.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • findUserById

      Optional<User> findUserById(int id) throws SQLException
      Finds a user by their unique ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique ID of the user to find.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the found User, or an empty Optional if no user with that ID exists.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • getAllUsers

      List<User> getAllUsers() throws SQLException
      Retrieves a list of all users from the database.
      Returns:
      A List of all User objects; the list may be empty if there are no users.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.
